issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Using the attached file in a project, I do not see a breakpoint being hit when inside the loop of the click event (line 31).

*Steps to reproduce issue*:
1. Use the attached app.js to create a new project
2. Add a breakpoint to line 31 (Ti.API.debug("Hello: " + i);)
3. Debug the project and click on the label: "I am Window 1"
4. Notice that the breakpoint is not hit

*Expected result*:
The breakpoint is hit on each iteration of the for-loop
fields.summary: Debugger: Breakpoint not hit in loop of click event

comments.body: [~ewieber] Hi, this issue doesn't seem to persist on the 5.2.0.Could you test it again please ?  Its quite an old ticket so i wasn't able to re-produce the issue as i couldn't run SDK 3.5.1/2. Thanks!

Verified I am no longer able to reproduce this issue using:

MacOS 10.11.3 (15D21)
Studio 4.5.0.201602170821
Ti SDK 5.2.1.v20160316113102
Appc NPM 4.2.4-2
Appc CLI 5.2.1-12
Alloy 1.7.35
Xcode 7.2.1 (7C1002)

Likely, it was resolved with one of the several debugger tickets between the filing of this ticket and the 5.2.0 release.
